channel.title: Relative Risk on Jose Romeo Villarreal
channel.description: Recent content in Relative Risk on Jose Romeo Villarreal

item.title: Odds Ratio as an estimator of Relative Risk
item.description: Introduction Relative Risk (RR) is a parameter frequently reported in cohort studies. It indicates the risk of a certain outcome with a specific risk factor in relation to a control group without such risk factor. The case-control study design does not allow the the calculation of the RR, so instead the Odds Ratio (OR) is used. When the prevalence of the outcome is low, the OR is a good approximation to the RR.
